bill_title: provide for an opt out by certain professions from the temporary licensing compact.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for an opt out by certain professions from the temporary licensing compact. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The Legislature finds that for the professions regulated under chapters 36-4, 36-5, 36-6A, 36-7, and 36-18A the professional licensing requirements in each of the member states of the Interstate Compact for the Temporary Licensure of Professionals are deemed inadequate to protect the public health and safety. The Legislature further finds that the respective criteria to become a licensed professional in this state are sufficiently expeditious, provide reasonable requirements to protect the public health and safety, and are not unduly burdensome to afford out-of-state license holders a pathway to licensure by applying for a license as provided for in chapters 36-4, 36-5, 36-6A, 36-7, and 36-18A. Pursuant to section VI, an opt out of the Interstate Compact for the Temporary Licensure of Professionals, the Legislature declines to afford reciprocity and declines to grant temporary licensure to license holders in member states of the Interstate Compact for the Temporary Licensure of Professionals for the professions regulated under chapters 36-4, 36-5, 36-6A, 36-7, and 36-18A.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for an opt out by certain professions from the temporary licensing compact. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The Legislature finds that for the professions regulated under chapters 36-4, 36-5, 36-6A, 36-7, 36-11, 36-18A, and 36-26 professional licensing requirements in each of the member states of the Interstate Compact for the Temporary Licensure of Professionals are deemed inadequate to protect the public health and safety. The Legislature further finds that the respective criteria to become a licensed professional in this state are sufficiently expeditious, provide reasonable requirements to protect the public health and safety, and are not unduly burdensome to afford out-of-state license holders a pathway to licensure by applying for a license as provided for in chapters 36-4, 36-5, 36-6A, 36-7, 36-11, 36-18A, and 36-26. Pursuant to section VI, an opt out of the Interstate Compact for the Temporary Licensure of Professionals, the Legislature declines to afford reciprocity and declines to grant temporary licensure to license holders in member states of the Interstate Compact for the Temporary Licensure of Professionals for the professions regulated under chapters 36-4, 36-5, 36-6A, 36-7, 36-11, 36-18A, and 36-26.
